166198417.reviewBody: The pool are great , security guards are super friendly, The bbq areas , everything is so close by to the resort.

165349747.name: Nice short side trip from San Diego
165349747.author: a TripAdvisor user
165349747.reviewBody: Nice beach.  Not far from San Diego.  People come for the beach, restaurant, and shopping.  Like all Mexico, you need to do some haggling.\n\nUnless you stay on the beach, couple of hours (including lunch) is all you need to go though the town.

163737131.name: exellent
163737131.author: a TripAdvisor user
163737131.reviewBody: is a very nice beach to visit,you will enjoy the nice weather and those wonderfull sunsets,bewere of the tourist traps.

162169434.name: Surfing North of Malibu Point, Rosarito
162169434.author: a TripAdvisor user
162169434.reviewBody: Great, uncrowded beach breaks with the occasional points to be found, area takes a good combo swell with NW and SW swells.  Be aware of strong rip currents, but the water looks clean and there\'s plenty of sandy coves to get lost in...!

161508160.name: Come and visit here anytime !
161508160.author: a TripAdvisor user
161508160.reviewBody: We always frequent Rosarito Beach - - They have everything and the beaches are very clean, safe and lots of fun.. Don\'t be afraid to come down from the US; Don\'t listen to just the \'bad\' things that the news reports... This is still one of the safest areas to visit in Mexico... (Much safer than a lot of US cities)... Come visit and have a great time at this great white sandy beach!

161348750.name: Typical Tourist Destination
161348750.author: a TripAdvisor user
161348750.reviewBody: This is one of the most traveled to destinations in Baha California being that is the closes city to the San Diego/Tijuana Border crossing. You can have a good time and find good value if you shop and price compare. nice tourist town if that\'s what your looking for. It\'s easy to get to on the pay road and worth the drive.

160217342.name: Relaxing, casual, quiet, beach resort town
160217342.author: a TripAdvisor user
160217342.reviewBody:
My sister, brother-in-law, and I found Rosarito Beach an inviting place to get away from it all, about 40 minutes from the US border.  You'll find that the town itself strings along an old north-south road now replaced by better & bigger highways.  The northern end of town serves the local populace with banks, car shops, & other stores, even a big Wal-Mart, while tourists tend to congregate in the southern end of town where you'll find plenty of lodging and eateries.  In comparison to Ensenada, its bigger competitor down the coast, Rosarito is lower profile and more attractive if that's what you want.    
Americans, who tend to be security conscious, will find RB a disarmingly quite and simple place.  Rest, enjoy the wide & sandy beaches.  We didn't look for loud, noisy bars but I'm sure they're there.  
The drive from the US border in Tijuana is easy and well marked.  Just follow the signs that say "Scenic road to Ensenada" and you'll get there in a jiffy.  
We had a relaxing, casual experience and you will too.

160181784.name: Its a nice place but...
160181784.author: a TripAdvisor user
160181784.reviewBody: Rosarito is a nice place but theres not much to do other than restaurants, beach and that\u00b4s it. Rosarito is only for a day or 2 but for a long vacation don\u00b4t think so.

159650726.name: Good food
159650726.author: a TripAdvisor user
159650726.reviewBody: We got just tacos because of big lunch. but was the best carne asada we have had in a while. Service great 8 pm.

159648619.name: Popotla fishing village
159648619.author: a TripAdvisor user
159648619.reviewBody: A great local experience.  This fishing village is the perfect village.  We didn\'t buy any as we aren\'t cooking but it totally fun looking about at all the fish stalls.  The spider crabs were huge.  A short distance from where we are staying so walked in.

158806002.name: Clean and long beach
158806002.author: a TripAdvisor user
158806002.reviewBody: Beach is cleaned everyday, one of the cleanest I ever seen. It\'s also very long so you can walk about 1hour one way or make a jogging.\nSellers are everywhere but... it\'s better then beggers.\nSome restaurants/bar on the beach if you need and some toilets also.

155904678.name: Beauty
155904678.author: a TripAdvisor user
155904678.reviewBody: walking the beach at night or durring the day is sooo much fun.. but when walking it at night is so much fun they light fire crackers have music and all the party people are out.

155792466.name: Weekend visit with the family
155792466.author: a TripAdvisor user
155792466.reviewBody: Felt very safe. The weather was perfect, the beach was clean. The kids loved it. Stayed at the Rosarito Beach Hotel and had a great time.

154918896.name: A little nasty, but not bad
154918896.author: a TripAdvisor user
154918896.reviewBody: Just trash on the beach, is my complaint. We had a great time, the beach just needs people to not leave their trash all over.

154908194.name: Just a Half Hour South of San Diego
154908194.author: a TripAdvisor user
154908194.reviewBody: This is a town of a different flavor -- it\'s a different kind of Mexico... There are resorts and American style condos here and the prices are extremely reasonable. Since the chaos that has arisen over the last several years the number of tourists seems to have dropped off, but as a result everything is very affordable, The people here are some of the nicest that we\'ve ever met and they seem genuinely interested in helping. I suggest staying on the main streets and sample a little bit of the local fare from a few different places. These are authentic taco stands and Mexican restaurants. There are few places in the USA that prepare food like here and our favorite place is called Taqueria 2000 which is a about 100 yards off Benito Juarez Bl. on Calle Ensenada, 5 doors down from the Llantera La Mejor on the corner! Here you will find this tiny little taqueria where they grill their meats on a flame and chop it it up on a tree stump -- get the the quesedilla con carne con todos and have enjoy sample of real Mexican food the way it is supposed to taste. Their are gems all over this town!

150989034.name: to many turists
150989034.author: a TripAdvisor user
150989034.reviewBody: rosarito has gone completly turist minded and lost the true mexican charm.  Everyone is out to get the most out of your american dollars and forgetting true mexican charm

150453053.name: a place in the sun
150453053.author: a TripAdvisor user
150453053.reviewBody: Loved it. dont walk barefoot on the beach, alot of broken glass. other than that very enjoyable. you can rent horses or atvs right on the beach. dolphins head south in the morning and north in the evenings.\n\nLooking at retiring there in about 4 years

149514547.name: Not crowded
149514547.author: a TripAdvisor user
149514547.reviewBody: Did not like the fact current road repairs so there is detours. But not much happening in downtown Rosarito Beach

145453381.name: Cold
145453381.author: a TripAdvisor user
145453381.reviewBody: It has been rare that we find the sun beaming in Rosarito. It is usually downcast, but still worth visiting. The ambiance of the vendors and other tourist is great. Get your hair brtaided or buy a corn on the cob. Buckets of beers brought right to you, or if you prefer a margarita they can bring that to you too.\n\nVisit every 3 to 4 months, long drive from San Jose, but worth it

145399461.name: Firewood in Rosarito, Cantamar
145399461.author: a TripAdvisor user
145399461.reviewBody: Lena Rosarito is the best !!!!  They deliver. I bought my first two bundles indirectly, but will go direct from now on. What a great service!!!

143288013.name: Beaches here are must cleaner and prettier than in Tijuana.
143288013.author: a TripAdvisor user
143288013.reviewBody: Beaches here are must cleaner and prettier than in Tijuana and a great place to walk your dogs on the beach with no restrictions.

141265326.name: If you an find parking then this is the place to be !
141265326.author: a TripAdvisor user
141265326.reviewBody: Parking is crazy but thats any beach right ? We loaded our car we bought beer and we sat at the beach drinking coronas and grilling burgers ( things you can no longer do in LA such a shame.) there are tons of venders with wheel barrels selling nuts candy, dryed fruit, kites, churros, Giant Coconuts with shrimp, jewlery, you name it ill probably cross your path at some point, the water is ice cubes yr around from what i understand but i still reallly liked this beach inspite of the water.

139414864.name: Just all right
139414864.author: a TripAdvisor user
139414864.reviewBody: Although it is a lovely location the food is not worth the stop.  I would suggest having a cocktail, if your lucky enough to get served at the bar and go for a walk on the beach.  The service at the bar is a joke really, they will ignore you for I don\'t really know how long, since we gave up after 30 mins.

137473391.name: good for lunch or dinner
137473391.author: a TripAdvisor user
137473391.reviewBody: Great Lobster and Frijoles. Nothing else to see. After being in other beaches in Mexican Territory, honestly, there aren\u00b4t nice spots to even take a picture. Food is great by the way.

136543226.name: prefer beaches down the road
136543226.author: a TripAdvisor user
136543226.reviewBody: certainly worth a look as it is full of so many varieties of everything. Scary and exciting! For swimming and surfing select a beach up or down the road which is cleaner and safer.

136291606.name: Dog poop everywhere
136291606.author: a TripAdvisor user
136291606.reviewBody: On the weekends all the locals come to spend there summer weekends that includes there furry friends.  Be careful if you are headed out for a stroll along the shoreline.  People are so busy having fun splashing in the ocean that they forget to tend to there pets.  Lots of dog poop.  I step in my fair share. Other than that it was fun all the activity going on at the beach.  Lots of vendors ready to make deals.

135995626.name: Do like the locals do?
135995626.author: a TripAdvisor user
135995626.reviewBody: If you are adventurous enough. Go to the north side of the public.  It might not seem like much at first, but during the summer, you will be amongst the locals. Take plenty of cash, as street vendors here become beach vendors (ice cream, churros, coconuts, fruit cups, candy, jewelry, even musicians!).

134667053.name: The beach
134667053.author: a TripAdvisor user
134667053.reviewBody: The beach was nice and relaxing. There are some vendors walking up and down the beach selling their wares, but they leave you alone if you just say no. Left side of the pier is bit quiet since the vendors mostly concentrate their efforts to the right side of the pier.

134219380.name: used to be fun, now scary and commercialized
134219380.author: a TripAdvisor user
134219380.reviewBody: Its Northern Mexico..do you really need to know why??

133470675.name: COOL, FUN, RELAXING
133470675.author: a TripAdvisor user
133470675.reviewBody: I love Rosarito. Many things not positive are said about Mexico. However I haven\'t found any of the rumors to be correct. The people of Rosarito are friendly, food is crazy good an if you\'re looking for a laid back good time...you can\'t miss in Rosarito. I live here most of the time now and love it..

133360856.name: Fun!
133360856.author: a TripAdvisor user
133360856.reviewBody: There\'s lots to do on Rosarito beach! It was full of people on a beautiful Saturday, but it didn\'t feel crowded. My friend rode a horse ($10 for 30 minutes), we drank coconut water straight from the coconuts, and we took a stroll down the beach. There\'s also surfing, and you can swim if you don\'t mind the cold. Very fun for a girls getaway weekend!

131281222.name: clubs
131281222.author: a TripAdvisor user
131281222.reviewBody: great place to be on a weekend it sets u in aparty mood

131221741.name: Beautiful Beach
131221741.author: a TripAdvisor user
131221741.reviewBody: If you live in California it\'s the same water just different environment especially go when the Art festival is in the area

131014634.name: Go to Rosarito!
131014634.author: a TripAdvisor user
131014634.reviewBody: Lots of stuff to do! You can rent surf boards and wetsuits for about $10-15 bucks, ride a horse for 30-60 min from $10-20 bucks, rent quads to ride along the beach, get drinks and dance right on the sand, take a wine tour etc. You can get a pineapple/coconut drink with alcohol in it for $12 bucks and they give you the pineapple they carved out to eat with chile and limon. Yum! Very fun place to get cool gifts and mexican memorabilia. The beach is safe! All the negative media propaganda is just hype. Just like anywhere in the world, including the US, don\'t be stupid and get into trouble.

130495006.name: way better than what it was a few years back!
130495006.author: a TripAdvisor user
130495006.reviewBody: I was just there with my wife and son. The beaches where clean, I was shocked cause I was their a few years back and the sand was littered with beer bottles and trash, nonetheless, not any more. My son and I took a horse ride down the shoreline at a very good price. Hint cheap price. Afterwards, I had a two for one margaritas that was poorly made, it hardly had tequila. But not all are made the same, I moved on and found another place. Way better, got my buzz on after one drink.  The vendors get a bit annoying though, they seem to never stop coming to you trying to get you to buy something. If you can get past that you will be ok. I would recommend visiting the town but I couldn\'t stay longer than a weekend.

129330462.name: Cleaned up!
129330462.author: a TripAdvisor user
129330462.reviewBody: Rosarito is cleaned up, repainted and safe!  No more beggars on the streets, the kids are all in school!  It\'s NICE

128943375.name: Chasing the Mist
128943375.author: a TripAdvisor user
128943375.reviewBody:
It was so wonderful to see the locals enjoying a place that is usually over run with obnoxious tourists. I was there New Year's Day with my boyfriend (the resident!). The beach was full of happy families having their beach picnics even though the weather was cool and the sun just barely scaring the mists away. The water and sky were silver grey...
To me it was a perfect, normal day at the beach. 
There were no naked humans giving themselves radiation poisoning. No personal beauty pageants. No sharp eyes cutting you with judgements. No pretentiousness... 
Yes. A perfect day at the beach.

127215359.name: just so so
127215359.author: a TripAdvisor user
127215359.reviewBody: too many young teens.  crowded.  Not enough quality restaurants and wines.

126186587.name: People watching beach. .
126186587.author: a TripAdvisor user
126186587.reviewBody: We went to Papas & Beer to watch the super bowl and during half time we strolled the beach. It was very crowded for as cool as it was that day. Mostly locals. There are lots of vendors walking around and you could ride a flying go cart for a fee. (I\'m sure there is a name for those cart but I don\'t know it) it was a pleasant afternoon!  One tip, watch the parking attendants. They told us that if you are patronizing Papas & Beer, there is free parking, but they still tried to get us to pay when we walked across the street to bar! So, we walked back to the car to go somewhere else and they magically remembered that they told us it was free! So, we stayed.

124986468.name: Great town
124986468.author: a TripAdvisor user
124986468.reviewBody: great place to browse through the stores.  If you\'re older avoid this during spring break and summer weekends.

124895839.name: Nice Beach!
124895839.author: a TripAdvisor user
124895839.reviewBody: Once you get past the vendors (who really aren\'t bad and offer CHEAP drinks!) you can stroll  on the beach for miles. If you want to go horseback riding on the beach -Saddle up! There is a pier you can walk out on as well. In town there is a great coffee shop where they roast their own coffee beans. Be sure to drop by to pick up some coffee and then buy a cup of espresso to sip on. There are chairs inside and outside the coffee shop. Great place to sit back, relax and smell the coffee. Aromas del Che Cafe is the name of the place.

124721206.name: Just another pacific beach
124721206.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721206.reviewBody: but warmer than San Francisco and nice mexican touch.

124631450.name: white sandy beaches
124631450.author: a TripAdvisor user
124631450.reviewBody: fun restaurants and bars, pet friendly beaches. Our dog loves to hang out on the beach with us.

122592147.name: Wonderful beaches...
122592147.author: a TripAdvisor user
122592147.reviewBody: .... and surfing.  Contrary to what a previous review states, no cruise ship docks or ever docked here.  It is not a port!  Therere are a few fine restaurants, and a lot of shopping.\nHorseback riding on the beach is one of several attractions.

120628363.name: November
120628363.author: a TripAdvisor user
120628363.reviewBody: We were there in November. Not really beach weather.

116688390.name: Don\'t go in the water
116688390.author: a TripAdvisor user
116688390.reviewBody: Sewage from neighborhoods in the adjacent hills runs down creeks and directly into the ocean and passing cruise ships have their trash wash up on shore.  The city does a good job cleaning up the beach every morning, but even if it looks clean, the water isn\'t.  Stay out of the water because it is polluted.  Also, it still isn\'t very safe here yet.  This can be verified in the local newspapers serving Rosarito and Tijuana that show massive daily crime reports.

4773900.name: Beware:  Corrupt Police want Your Money!
4773900.author: a TripAdvisor user
4773900.reviewBody:
My roommate and I were near Rosarito Beach to surf and camp in a local campground, and we were "shaken down" by the police TWICE for bribe money last weekend! The stories you hear about police corruption are absolutely true, and I'm living proof.

We have been going to Rosarito and Puerto Nuevo with our family for many years without problems, but our family was stopped in Tijuana last fall because my dad was driving while using his cell phone, (which is NOT against Mexican law, by the way.) When the officer saw my dad's sheriff's badge, he let us go. Last weekend, we were stopped twice-- the first time without reason. I speak Spanish fluently, and when I refused to offer a bribe but said I would rather go the police station to pay a fine legally, the officer took us to the station, opening a dark, stinking cell, and told us to get in. At that point, I said in Spanish, "Ok, what do you want?" He closed the door to the office and asked how much we had. Forty five dollars later, we were free...

Free, that is, until the next day when we went into town to drop off our bag of trash from cleaning up our campground. The bag was in the back of my truck and, yes, had a couple of empty beer cans in it, so this time we were picked up for "open containers." I went to the ATM but also called home. When my mom explained politely in Spanish that my dad is a San Diego sheriff and they would be happy to come and pay any fine, the policeman immediately said, "No, it's okay-- they can go." 

So be prepared: only cash or a badge will set you free.We have contacts in high places in Baja but still we were vulnerable-- and there are no guarantees you won't be asked to "sign this form and we'll let you go" and instead you have signed a confession. Baja police can be CORRUPT!
